newsitem.title: USA: U.S. crudes ending week quietly, outrights decline.
newsitem.headline: U.S. crudes ending week quietly, outrights decline.

text.p: U.S. cash crude prices remained stagnant for domestic grade barrels Friday afternoon, but outright values retreated to deeper losses.

June West Texas Intermediate/Cushing was down around 35 cents at $19.50-60 a barrel, declining in-line with profit-taking losses on the NYMEX. Product prices were also blamed for pushing outright crude lower, traders said.
The only feature of note for grade business was a slight firming trend for Light Louisiana Sweet/St. James, which talked at a 1-2 cts discount to June WTI/Cushing from a 5-10 cts deficit on Thursday.
